meanings.definition: A metabolite of nicotine found in the blood and urine of smokers.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the level of cotinine in my blood indicates my smoking habits.
meanings.sent2: Researchers use cotinine levels to determine if someone is a smoker.
meanings.sent3: I joked that my cotinine levels were so high, I must have tobacco plants growing inside me!
meanings.sent4: Her bloodstream was like a river of cotinine, revealing her smoking history.
meanings.sent5: The cotinine test results were as clear as day, showing the impact of smoking on her health.

meanings.definition: A biomarker used to measure tobacco exposure.
meanings.sent1: The lab technician analyzed the cotinine levels in the urine sample to assess tobacco exposure.
meanings.sent2: Cotinine testing is a common method to determine if someone has been around tobacco smoke.
meanings.sent3: I imagined a tiny cotinine detective inside me, sniffing out any tobacco exposure.
meanings.sent4: The cotinine marker glowed like a beacon, revealing the extent of tobacco exposure.
meanings.sent5: The cotinine measurement provided a direct link to the amount of tobacco exposure over time.
